location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 17/8 II Typewriters, supply of - Corr. re:-'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. Circled serial numbers (red for received correspondence; blue/black for issued correspondence) refer to notes at the rear of the volume, ff 281-326.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 327; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. Two additional foliation sequences are present in parallel between ff 2-235 and 282-308; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: Correspondence regarding the supply and maintenance of typewriters for the Political Agency, Bahrain.The primary correspondents are the Political Agency, Bahrain; the Political Residency, Persian Gulf; the Residency Agent, Sharjah; the Central Stationery Office, Calcutta; and the customs houses at Bahrain and Karachi. The file also contains letters and bills from office supply businesses and shipping agents.

name.namePart: Government of India, Central Stationery Office
